name: Payyed Gateway for WooCommerce
author: qqqjus

sections.description:
Accept payments from MPESA, PayPal, Stripe, Intasend, Flutterwave, Credit Cards, Debit Cards via Payyed.org, we host 10+ payment gateways making it flexible to shift between any at will. This plugin fully relies on the services from payyed.org (where payment gateways are hosted). This is a woocomemrce payment plugin that you can rely on!

With Payyed Gateway for WooCommerce, you can accept payments via:

  • Credit/Debit Cards
  • MPESA
  • PayPal
  • PayStack
  • Stripe
  • Authorize.net
  • Intasend
  • Payyed
  • Flutterwave
  • And more ++

Why this plugin of Payyed?

  • Start receiving payments instantly—go from sign-up to your first real transaction in as little as 2 minutes
  • Connect your own gateways and receive payments direct
  • Modern, seamless payment experience via the Payyed Checkout
  • Advanced fraud detection
  • Understand your customers better through a simple and elegant dashboard
  • Access to attentive, empathetic customer support 24/7
  • Free updates as we launch new features and payment options
  • Clearly documented APIs to build your custom payment experiences

Businesses of all sizes rely on Payyed’s suite of products to receive payments and make payouts seamlessly. Sign up on payyed.org/signup to get started. Please check the terms https://payyed.org/home/terms

Getting Started

  • Go to https://payyed.org/ and create account using your name, email and phone contact
  • Click settings and generate your private key
  • Go back to your WordPress backend >> Woocommerce settings and enter the key generated
  • Save and that is all!

Suggestions / Feature Request

If you have suggestions or a new feature request, feel free to get in touch with me via the contact form on my website here
sections.installation:
• Go to WordPress Admin > Plugins > Add New from the left-hand menu
  • In the search box type Payyed Gateway for WooCommerce
  • Click on Install now when you see Payyed Gateway for WooCommerce to install the plugin
  • After installation, activate the plugin.
  • Go to Payyed.org, login and get your API keys.

Payyed Setup and Configuration

  • Go to WooCommerce > Settings and click on the Payments tab
  • You’ll see Payyed listed along with your other payment methods. Click Set Up
  • On the next screen, configure the plugin. There is a selection of options on the screen. Read what each one does below.
  1. Enable/Disable – Check this checkbox to Enable Payyed on your store’s checkout
  2. Title – This will represent Payyed on your list of Payment options during checkout. It guides users to know which option to select to pay with Payyed. Title is set to “Pay via Payyed” by default, but you can change it to suit your needs.

  3. Description – This controls the message that appears under the payment fields on the checkout page. Use this space to give more details to customers about what Payyed is and what payment methods they can use with it.

  4. API Keys – The next two text boxes are for your Payyed API keys, which you can get from your Payyed Dashboard.

  5. Click on Save Changes to update the settings.
sections.faq:
What Do I Need To Use The Plugin

  • A Payyed merchant account—use an existing account or create an account here
  • An active WooCommerce installation
  • A valid SSL Certificate
